Description: Bright blue-green glazed composition (faience) bowl with circular foot and flaring base, slightly flaring sides and plain rim. The exterior is decorated with a painted flower motif, the interior with a representation of three interlocking fish with birds and floral motifs between. The rim is chipped.
Curator's comments: On small faience bowls of the New Kingdom, including bowls and small drinking vessels, see Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 140-45.
